What is the purpose of the `z_exportwallet` command in Verus?
The `z_exportwallet` command is used to export all wallet keys, both transparent (taddr) and shielded (zaddr), in a human-readable format.

z_exportwallet "filename" (omitemptytaddresses) Exports all wallet keys, for taddr and zaddr, in a human-readable format. Overwriting an existing file is not permitted. Arguments: 1. "filename"      (string, required) The filename, saved in folder set by verusd -exportdir option 2. "omitemptytaddresses" (boolean, optional) Defaults to false. If true, export only addresses with indexed UTXOs or that control IDs in the wallet                        (do not use this option without being sure that all addresses of interest are included) Result: "path"      (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus z_exportwallet "test" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_exportwallet", "params": ["test"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_exportwallet
What are the required and optional arguments for the `z_exportwallet` command?

The required argument is the "filename" string, which specifies the filename for the exported wallet keys. The optional argument is "omitemptytaddresses", a boolean that defaults to false. If set to true, the command will only export addresses with indexed UTXOs or that control IDs in the wallet.

z_exportwallet "filename" (omitemptytaddresses) Exports all wallet keys, for taddr and zaddr, in a human-readable format. Overwriting an existing file is not permitted. Arguments: 1. "filename"      (string, required) The filename, saved in folder set by verusd -exportdir option 2. "omitemptytaddresses" (boolean, optional) Defaults to false. If true, export only addresses with indexed UTXOs or that control IDs in the wallet                        (do not use this option without being sure that all addresses of interest are included) Result: "path"      (string) The full path of the destination file Examples: > verus z_exportwallet "test" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_exportwallet", "params": ["test"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_exportwallet
What is the effect of setting "omitemptytaddresses" to true when using the `z_exportwallet` command?

When "omitemptytaddresses" is set to true, the `z_exportwallet` command will only export addresses that have indexed UTXOs or control IDs in the wallet. This means that addresses without indexed UTXOs or controlling IDs will not be included in the exported file.

How can I use the `z_exportwallet` command to export my wallet keys to a file named "test"?

You can use the `z_exportwallet` command to export your wallet keys to a file named "test" by running the following command: `verus z_exportwallet "test"`. Alternatively, you can use the JSON-RPC API by running the following command: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_exportwallet", "params": ["test"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`.
